question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Single Validator] If there is only one validator, are there any edge cases in the loops at lines 60-66 that could cause incorrect address generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Maximum Validators] What is the maximum number of validators supported, and can exceeding this limit cause integer overflow in loop counters or map sizes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Unicode Addresses] If validator or employee addresses contain unusual Unicode characters, could this cause issues in YAML serialization at lines 90/95? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [File Truncation] If an existing pool address file is larger than the new content, does write_to_file() truncate properly or leave trailing data? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Atomic Write] Are the file writes at lines 87-96 atomic, or can power loss/crashes leave partially written files that corrupt genesis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [File Permissions] What permissions are set on the output files, and could overly permissive settings allow unauthorized modification of pool addresses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Directory Creation] If output_dir doesn't exist, does dir_default_to_current() create it with secure permissions, or could it create directories accessible to other users? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [File Locking] Are the output files locked during write to prevent concurrent modification by other processes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Owner/Operator Swap] Can an attacker swap owner and operator addresses in validator configuration causing default_stake_pool_address() to generate incorrect addresses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Self-Operated Validators] If owner_account_address equals operator_account_address, does this cause any issues in pool address generation at lines 61-64? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Validator Metadata] Does the validator object contain additional fields beyond owner/operator that should influence pool address generation but are ignored? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Operator Reuse] Can multiple validators share the same operator_account_address, and does this cause any security issues in pool address uniqueness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Employee Validator Mismatch] Does employee_pool.validator at line 72 reference a valid validator from the main validator list, or can orphaned references cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Beneficiary Confusion] Are employee beneficiary addresses validated before pool address generation, or can invalid beneficiaries cause vesting pool lockup? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Vesting Schedule Mismatch] Does the pool address generation depend on vesting schedules, and could schedule manipulation cause address mismatches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Multiple Employees Per Pool] If an employee pool has multiple accounts, does this affect address generation or could it cause confusion about pool ownership? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Determinism Testing] Has address generation been tested across multiple executions to ensure fully deterministic output with identical inputs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Cross-Platform Testing] Have the address generation functions at lines 61-64 and 71-76 been tested on different OSes and architectures to ensure consistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Collision Testing] Has testing been performed with adversarially chosen validator addresses to verify no pool address collisions occur? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Large Scale Testing] Has the tool been tested with thousands of validators and employees to verify it handles mainnet-scale genesis without issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Pool Address Prediction] Can an attacker who knows validator owner/operator addresses predict stake pool addresses before genesis and deploy contracts to those addresses first? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Resource Address Collision] Could malicious validators craft addresses that collide with system resource addresses, causing conflicts with framework modules? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [Cross-Account Attacks] Can an attacker create validator configurations where their stake pool address equals another validator's account address enabling theft? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/genesis/tools.rs] [Function: execute()] [YAML Parsing Attacks] When the generated YAML files are later parsed, could crafted addresses cause vulnerabilities in downstream YAML parsers? (Medium)
